snippet: The Commerce Department reported that the economy, adjusted for inflation, expanded at a better-than-expected annual rate in the April-June quarter.
abstract: Commerce Department reports economy, adjusted for inflation, expanded at better-than-expected annual rate of 1.7 percent in April-June quarter; results top Wall Street forecasts of just under 1 percent.

byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ and CATHERINE RAMPELL

lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department reported that the economy, adjusted for inflation, expanded at a better-than-expected annual rate in the April-June quarter.

headline.main: U.S. Economy Grew 1.7% During the 2nd Quarter, Topping Forecasts
headline.print_headline: Piecing Together The Nation’s Economic Picture
